author: andrew951
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
$credential = get-credential
New-PSSession -ConfigurationName Microsoft.Exchange -ConnectionUri "https://outlook.office365.com/powershell-liveid/" -Credential $credential -Authentication "Basic" -AllowRedirection

```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none

```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
New-PSSession : [outlook.office365.com] Connecting to remote server outlook.office365.com failed with the following error message : MI_RESULT_FAILED For more information, see 
the about_Remote_Troubleshooting Help topic.
At line:1 char:12
+ $Session = New-PSSession -ConfigurationName Microsoft.Exchange -Conne ...
+            ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : OpenError: (System.Manageme....RemoteRunspace:RemoteRunspace) [New-PSSession], PSRemotingTransportException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : 1,PSSessionOpenFailed
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value                                                                                                                                             
----                           -----                                                                                                                                             
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta.8                                                                                                                                      
PSEdition                      Core                                                                                                                                              
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.8                                                                                                                                     
OS                             Linux 4.4.0-97-generic #120-Ubuntu SMP Tue Sep 19 17:28:18 UTC 2017                                                                               
Platform                       Unix                                                                                                                                              
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                                                                           
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                                                                               
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1                                                                                                                                           
WSManStackVersion              3.0 
```

comments.author: andrew951
comments.body: I tested on both Ubuntu and Mac OS X. This stopped working after Beta 6 was released. It is working in Beta 5.

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
@andrew951,

FYI - Variable error $cred <> $credential.

Works in Ubuntu for me.

```
PowerShell v6.0.0-beta.8
Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-beta.8> $cred = get-credential

PowerShell credential request
Enter your credentials.
User: maxt@flpowershellug.onmicrosoft.com
Password for user maxt@flpowershellug.onmicrosoft.com: ************

PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-beta.8> New-PSSession -ConfigurationName Microsoft.Exchange -ConnectionUri "https:/
/outlook.office365.com/powershell-liveid/" -Credential $cred -Authentication "Basic" -AllowRedirection

 Id Name            ComputerName    ComputerType    State         ConfigurationName     Availability
 -- ----            ------------    ------------    -----         -----------------     ------------
  1 WinRM1          outlook.offi... RemoteMachine   Opened        Microsoft.Exchange       Available


PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-beta.8> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----

PSEdition                      Core

PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-beta.8>
```

comments.author: andrew951
comments.body: @MaximoTrinidad my apologies. That was a typo. Issue still persists though. Your pwd is showing a C drive though?

comments.author: amdove
comments.body:
How about using the proxy method? 
`-ConnectionURI `https://outlook.office365.com/powershell-liveid/?proxymethod=rps`

comments.author: andrew951
comments.body:
@AmDove 
```
PS /root> New-PSSession -ConfigurationName Microsoft.Exchange -ConnectionURI "https://outlook.office365.com/powershell-liveid/?proxymethod=rps" -Credential $credential -Authentication "Basic" -AllowRedirection
New-PSSession : [outlook.office365.com] Connecting to remote server
outlook.office365.com failed with the following error message :
MI_RESULT_FAILED For more information, see the about_Remote_Troubleshooting
Help topic.
At line:1 char:1
+ New-PSSession -ConfigurationName Microsoft.Exchange -ConnectionUri "h ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : OpenError: (System.Manageme....RemoteRunspace:Re
   moteRunspace) [New-PSSession], PSRemotingTransportException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : 1,PSSessionOpenFailed
```
Tested on a fresh install of Ubuntu 16.04.3 LTS

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
@andrew951, 

My Bad!!  I've been working in multiple environments. You 're right!
Ubuntu 16.04.3 fail!

Apologies!

comments.author: mepples21
comments.body: Same issue here on macOS High Sierra:

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: This is an issue with the non-Windows WSMan client

comments.author: SBiliarski
comments.body:
Same here. Any workaround known?

![screenshot 2017-10-19 11 44 54](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32925821/31762138-f559b07c-b4c2-11e7-9282-a7e92e092c0f.png)

comments.author: andrew951
comments.body: @SBiliarski if it's urgent, you can install PS Version 6 beta 6. It is working in that.

comments.author: rolltide78
comments.body: Same for me on high Sierra. What about a basic remoting session to a Windows server from macos? Is that possible?

comments.author: NeuralGlue
comments.body:
@andrew951 are you sure the session invocation worked for you in PS 6.0.0-beta.6? It's not working for me on OS X 10.12.6 (Sierra)
                                                                                                                                                                                      
```
$PSVersionTable

PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                                                                                                                   
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                                                                                                                       
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1                                                                                                                                                                                   
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
 
         
```
New-PSSession -ConfigurationName Microsoft.Exchange -ConnectionUri "https://outlook.office365.com/powershell-liveid/" -Credential $credential -Authentication "Basic" -AllowRedirection     

New-PSSession : [outlook.office365.com] Connecting to remote server outlook.office365.com failed with the following error message : MI_RESULT_FAILED For more information, see the about_Remote_Troubleshooting Help 
topic.
At line:1 char:1
+ New-PSSession -ConfigurationName Microsoft.Exchange -ConnectionUri "h ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : OpenError: (System.Manageme....RemoteRunspace:RemoteRunspace) [New-PSSession], PSRemotingTransportException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : 1,PSSessionOpenFailed
```

If you had it working in 6.0b6, does it still work for you? 

I installed via:
`brew cask install https://github.com/caskroom/homebrew-cask/raw/ffaaa7b10a8f1f89ff13b4a0f9d2bad23ae62d7a/Casks/powershell.rb`

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: I don't think any changes have occurred in the wsman client layer so I'd be surprised if it worked for beta.6

comments.author: andrew951
comments.body: @NeuralGlue @SteveL-MSFT It works in beta.5. Starting with Beta.6, it has stopped working.

comments.author: rolltide78
comments.body: So is everyone just recommending to dowbgrade from 6?

comments.author: NeuralGlue
comments.body:
@andrew951 @rolltide78 I just tried downgrading to beta.5 then beta.4 on OS X 10.12.6 (Sierra). Neither version was able to connect though the error message was different: ERROR_WSMAN_INVALID_SELECTORS

Of course it's possible that my setup is idiosyncratic or that there is something in my Exchange Online account that is preventing me from connecting. I'll spin up a Windows machine soon and connect via the Windows binary.

```
$PSVersionTable                                                                                                                                                                                         
Name                           Value                                                                                                                                                                                     
----                           -----                                                                                                                                                                                     
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta                                                                                                                                                                                
PSEdition                      Core                                                                                                                                                                                      
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.5                                                                                                                                                                             
OS                             Darwin 16.7.0 Darwin Kernel Version 16.7.0: Thu Jun 15 17:36:27 PDT 2017; root:xnu-3789.70.16~2/RELEASE_X86_64                                                                            
Platform                       Unix                                                                                                                                                                                      
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                                                                                                                   
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                                                                                                                       
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1                                                                                                                                                                                   
WSManStackVersion              3.0     

 New-PSSession -ConfigurationName Microsoft.Exchange -ConnectionUri "https://outlook.office365.com/powershell-liveid/" -Credential $credential -Authentication "Basic" -AllowRedirection                 
New-PSSession : [outlook.office365.com] Processing data from remote server outlook.office365.com failed with the following error message: ERROR_WSMAN_INVALID_SELECTORS: The WS-Management service cannot process the 
request because the request contained invalid selectors for the resource.  For more information, see the about_Remote_Troubleshooting Help topic.
At line:1 char:1
+ New-PSSession -ConfigurationName Microsoft.Exchange -ConnectionUri "h ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : OpenError: (System.Manageme....RemoteRunspace:RemoteRunspace) [New-PSSession], PSRemotingTransportException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : 1,PSSessionOpenFailed
```

```
$PSVersionTable                                                                                                                                                                                         

Name                           Value                                                                                                                                                                                     
----                           -----                                                                                                                                                                                     
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta                                                                                                                                                                                
PSEdition                      Core                                                                                                                                                                                      
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.4                                                                                                                                                                             
OS                             Darwin 16.7.0 Darwin Kernel Version 16.7.0: Thu Jun 15 17:36:27 PDT 2017; root:xnu-3789.70.16~2/RELEASE_X86_64                                                                            
Platform                       Unix                                                                                                                                                                                      
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}                                                                                                                                                                   
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3                                                                                                                                                                                       
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1                                                                                                                                                                                   
WSManStackVersion              3.0      
'''

''' 
New-PSSession -ConfigurationName Microsoft.Exchange -ConnectionUri "https://outlook.office365.com/powershell-liveid/" -Credential $credential -Authentication "Basic" -AllowRedirection                 
New-PSSession : [outlook.office365.com] Processing data from remote server outlook.office365.com failed with the following error message: ERROR_WSMAN_INVALID_SELECTORS: The WS-Management service cannot process the 
request because the request contained invalid selectors for the resource.  For more information, see the about_Remote_Troubleshooting Help topic.
At line:1 char:1
+ New-PSSession -ConfigurationName Microsoft.Exchange -ConnectionUri "h ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : OpenError: (System.Manageme....RemoteRunspace:RemoteRunspace) [New-PSSession], PSRemotingTransportException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : 1,PSSessionOpenFailed
```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @dantraMSFT is working on a new drop of the Unix WSMan PSRP client so we should validate this scenario works

comments.author: adaviel
comments.body:
I have the same issue in powershell-6.0.0_beta.9-1.rhel.7.x86_64 on CentOS 7.4
Works in beta 5.1, fails in 6.1, per now-closed dup issue 5372

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @dantraMSFT is actively working on an updated psrp client library update which hopefully resolves this issue

comments.author: vandot
comments.body: I can also confirm that in also OSX 10.12.6 O365 remoting is broken in beta9 with MI_RESULT_FAILED, it works when downgrading to PS 6.0.0-beta.5.

comments.author: ssstonebraker
comments.body:
Installing PowerShell v6.0.4 on OSX 10.13.3 fixed the problem for me.

Install Link:
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/download/v6.0.4/powershell-6.0.4-osx.10.12-x64.pkg

comments.author: JoeJePropeller
comments.body:
Similar issue when trying to run the following:
`Invoke-Command -ComputerName 10.0.0.4 -Credential domain\administrator -ScriptBlock {write-host 123} -authentication kerberos -usessl`

I end up with the following returned:

`OpenError: [10.0.0.4] Connecting to remote server 10.0.0.4 failed with the following error message : MI_RESULT_FAILED For more information, see the about_Remote_Troubleshooting Help topic.`

`$PSVersionTable`:

```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.2.6
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.2.6
OS                             Linux 5.4.0-120-generic #136-Ubuntu SMP Fri Jun 10 13:40:48 UTC 2022
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

This is being ran from a Docker image. `Dockerfile`:

```
FROM mcr.microsoft.com/powershell:latest

RUN pwsh -Command 'Install-Module -Name PSWSMan -Force -Scope AllUsers'
RUN pwsh -Command 'Install-WSMan'


SHELL ["pwsh", "-Command"]
```

comments.author: phillippover
comments.body:
Has there been any progress on this issue? Getting the same in latest preview. Tried Alpine, Debian and Ubuntu, all with the same error:

OpenError: [SERVER] Connecting to remote server SERVER failed with the following error message : MI_RESULT_FAILED For more information, see the about_Remote_Troubleshooting Help topic.

```ps
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.3.0-rc.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.3.0-rc.1
OS                             Linux 5.10.102.1-microsoft-standard-WSL2 #1 SMP Wed Mar 2 00:30:59 UTC 2022
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

title: Cannot Connect to Office 365 with Powershell from non-Windows
